alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox; Loudon; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 1:23PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Loudon, central Knox, southeastern Anderson, northwestern Blount, north central Monroe and eastern Roane Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Clinton to near Loudon. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Clinton, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Kingston, Loudon, Farragut and Louisville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Knox; Loudon; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Roane
